intro: Lasiosiphon anthylloides var. glabrescens, commonly known as the glabrous lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and tubular flowers. The plant typically features hairy stems that become smooth as it matures, giving it its varietal name. Its flowers are usually pale purple or white, with five lobes, and bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
